comment.author: 47984368@N00
comment._content: This is not 155th street.  This museum is down on bowling green in what was the US customs house.

comment.realname: Smithsonian National Museum of the American Indian
comment.author: 36183987@N07
comment._content: The Museum of the American Indian (the predecessor to the Smithsonian’s National Museum of the American Indian) was located on the west side of Broadway between West 155th and 156th Street at what was called Audubon Terrace, a complex of cultural organizations built with the help of Archer Huntington on land formerly owned by John James Audubon.   In 1994, following the transfer of the Museum of the American Indian to the Smithsonian, the National Museum of the American Indian opened its current New York facility in the Alexander Hamilton U.S. Customs House at 1 Bowling Green in Manhattan near Battery Park.
comment.authorname: Smithsonian National Museum of the American Indian
